abstracts.cdata!:
The main development objectives of the
            EGAT - Investment Program Support Project are to: a) help
            the Electricity Generating Authority of Thailand (EGAT) meet
            its essential investment commitments on generation and
            transmission projects whose implementation has already been
            under way; b) help EGAT not lose ground in accomplishing its
            organizational restructuring and corporatization, and
            implementing its privatization strategy and c) help improve
            the regulatory framework for the energy sector. The project
            includes four generation projects and four transmission
            systems as follows: a) Krabi Thermal Power Plant Unit 1; b)
            Ratchaburi Power Plant Project; c) Wang Noi Combined Cycle
            Power Station, Stage II; d) 500KV Transmission System for
            Independent Power Producers and Hong Sa Project in Laos; e)
            bulk power supply for greater Bangkok; f) EGAT-TNB Stage II
            interconnection; g) Transmission System Expansion Project
            no. 9; and h) restructuring, corporatization, and
            privatization of EGAT. The project will also reform the
            regulatory system for the energy sector including a)
            formulation of corporate policy for environmental and social
            management; and b) strengthening EGAT's environmental
            management function.
